pattern.name: Time month part
pattern.description:
Identify, whether it's the beginning, middle or end of the month.
Note: Could return a continuous value (but it would double direct_time_part).
Note: I can use ODBC escape sequence to get the day of the month. But I can't get the count of days in the month -> what about just returning a day of month?
pattern.example: People are more likely to take a short-term loan a week before the paycheck day.
pattern.author: Jan Motl
pattern.code: SELECT @base , CEIL(day/days_in_month*3) AS @columnName FROM ( SELECT @base , extract(day FROM @column) AS day , add_months(trunc(@column,'MM'),1) - trunc(@column,'MM') AS days_in_month FROM @propagatedTable ) t

SELECT @base , CEIL(day/days_in_month*3) AS @columnName FROM ( SELECT @base , EXTRACT(DAY FROM @column) AS day , DATE_PART('day', DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', @column) + '1 MONTH'::INTERVAL - '1 DAY'::interval ) AS days_in_month FROM @propagatedTable ) t
